meanings.sent1: The teacher kept chivvying the students to finish their homework on time.
meanings.sent2: She was chivvying her brother to clean his room before their parents came home.
meanings.sent3: The little bird chivvied the cat by chirping loudly near its tail.
meanings.sent4: The persistent rain chivvied the hikers to seek shelter in the cave.
meanings.sent5: The alarm clock chivvied him awake every morning with its loud ringing.

meanings.definition: To urge or encourage someone to do something.
meanings.sent1: The coach kept chivvying the players to give their best effort in the game.
meanings.sent2: She was chivvying her friend to join her for a run in the park.
meanings.sent3: The dog chivvied its owner to play fetch by bringing the ball repeatedly.
meanings.sent4: The sun chivvied the flowers to bloom with its warm rays.
meanings.sent5: The music chivvied the crowd to start dancing with its lively beat.

meanings.definition: The act of pestering or annoying someone.
meanings.sent1: His constant chivvying of his sister led to her frustration.
meanings.sent2: The chivvying from the salesperson made the customer decide to leave the store.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel's chivvying of the birds for their food was comical to watch.
meanings.sent4: The chivvying of the mosquitoes during the camping trip was unbearable.
meanings.sent5: The child's chivvying of his parents for a new toy was relentless.
